creator: daniel.kane@thomsonreuters.com
text:
Example uriworkermap.properties : 

/* = myworker
!/images/* = myworker
!/*/images/* = myworker

Obviously, I'm just getting Apache to handle my image requests rather than waste jboss's time servicing them.

However, when I attempt to get http://www.mydomain.com/images/null it routes the request to jboss, even though that path was excluded.

This is specifically a problem with the path element "null"...no other non-existent resource name causes this behavior...

creator: knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text:
1. Apache HTTPD server version = ?

2. I wonder whether this is reproducible with the current mod_jk version (1.2.40).

Apache version 2.2.19_64bit

We are currently in the process of 'following corporate protocol' to get a current build of mod_jk tested.
creator: daniel.kane@thomsonreuters.com
daniel.kane@thomsonreuters.com
text: Apologies. We have determined that this was an apache rewrite misconfiguration issue, and *not* a mod_jk bug.
